thread_title: System Cleanup, Project Setup, and First Structured Build Work Day

1_narrative.title: Narrative & Context
items: A structured work session focused on system cleanup, project organization, and initial build preparation for multiple projects. The session began with routing design files and consolidating Product Requirement Documents (PRDs). It then involved reviewing and prioritizing all active projects, culminating in the discovery and organization of the full scope for the Property Connect London (PCL) project, which was more extensive than previously understood.

2_objectives.title: Objectives
items: System cleanup and foundation establishment.
Locking in projects and PRDs to their correct locations and states.
Performing first real build work, specifically on the Property Connect London (PCL) project.

3_success_criteria.title: Success Criteria
items: Figma items moved out of V7 root to designated project folder.
All PRDs gathered and distributed to correct Build Factory projects or pillars.
Missing READMEs created for Core Engine and Template Hub.
Projects assessed, prioritized, and scaffolded.
Full PCL scope discovered and organized into the Build Factory.
System declared clean and ready for build work.

4_decisions.title: Decisions & Rules
items: All Figma items are routed to PRJ_UI_Component_Library, not the V7 root.
PRD 6 (Copy) and PRD 7 (Branding) go to domain pillars, not the Build Factory.
Enterprise OS gets a combined Master PRD merging the B2B vision with the 8-module architecture.
Priority stack established: PCL > Enterprise OS > UI Library > Chatbot > Fitness > Dog > Voice.
Brand colors are NOT a blocker; they can be applied after templates are built.
PCL is defined as an 81+ page ecosystem with 3 web properties, 62 AI apps, and 5 spokes, not just a newsletter.
30+ Figma kits are mapped to specific component needs across all builds.

5_sops.title: SOPs / Workflows
items: Process for routing Figma items to the UI Component Library project.
Process for distributing PRDs to Build Factory projects or domain pillars.
Process for creating project scaffolds with 9-folder structure.
Process for creating state snapshots in the Navigation Centre.
Process for creating goal folders with progress tracking.

6_scripts.title: Scripts / Commands
items: Git commit command resulting in commit 9d534ab (51 files, 23,734 lines).

7_inputs_outputs.title: Inputs & Outputs
items: Inputs: Existing Figma files, PRDs, project files, PCL documents from Downloads/full property/ (81+ pages, 62 apps, 3 web properties).
Outputs: New directory `07_BUILD_FACTORY/PRJ_Enterprise_Platform/` with 9-folder scaffold.
Output: Master PRD file `07_BUILD_FACTORY/PRJ_Enterprise_Platform/02_Product/PRD_Enterprise_OS_V7_MASTER.md`.
Outputs: README.md files for `03_CORE_ENGINE/` and `05_TEMPLATE_HUB/`.
Outputs: 8 PRDs distributed to correct locations.
Outputs: 3 projects scaffolded (Fitness, Dog, Voice).
Output: State snapshot `01_NAVIGATION_CENTRE/STATE_SNAPSHOTS/2026-02-13.md`.
Outputs: Goal folders `GOAL_Enterprise_OS_Platform/` and `GOAL_UI_Component_Library/` in `01_NAVIGATION_CENTRE/ACTIVE_GOALS/`.
Output: Updated Property Connect London progress file.
Output: Copied PCL work into Build Factory: 18 PRDs, 9 design assets, 6 strategy docs, 4 architecture docs.
Output: Created brand identity brief for PCL.
Output: Revised PCL progress to 45%.

8_missteps.title: Missteps / Errors / Risks
items: Initial misunderstanding of PCL scope (thought it was just a newsletter and landing page, discovered it's a full 81+ page ecosystem).

9_blockers.title: Blockers
items: None. System is clean and ready for build work.

10_status.title: Status
items: System cleanup and project setup complete.
PCL project organized and progress assessed at 45% (strategy/research/PRDs done, visuals are the bottleneck).
Work session completed and committed.

11_progress.title: Progress Markers
items: Route 6 Figma items out of V7 root.
Gather all PRDs into Build Factory projects (8 PRDs across 5 projects + 2 pillars).
Create missing READMEs for Core Engine and Template Hub.
Create PRD_Enterprise_OS_V7_MASTER.md (992 lines).
Create PRJ_Enterprise_Platform with full 9-folder scaffold.
Review and assign PRDs with maturity grades and status.
Set milestones and create progress files per project.
Update Navigation Centre state snapshot.
Create priority stack.
Create goal folders for Enterprise OS Platform and UI Component Library.
Discover full PCL scope.
Copy all PCL work into Build Factory.
Update PCL strategy brief.
Create PCL brand identity brief.
Revise PCL progress to 45%.
File session summary.
Commit to git (9d534ab).

12_refinements.title: Refinements
items: Refined PCL strategy brief to reflect full ecosystem scope.
Refined PCL progress assessment from previous state to 45%.
Refined project priority order into a defined stack.
Refined location strategy for PRDs and Figma assets.

13_dependencies.title: Dependencies
items: UI Component Library depends on Figma kits and autolayout knowledge.
All builds depend on the UI Component Library for components.
Enterprise OS design/architecture depends on being LLM-agnostic.
Template application depends on brand colors, but this is not a blocking dependency.

14_entities.title: Entity Maps
items: Projects: Property Connect London (PCL), Enterprise OS, UI Component Library, Chatbot, Fitness, Dog, Voice.
Directories: 07_BUILD_FACTORY/, 01_NAVIGATION_CENTRE/, 03_CORE_ENGINE/, 05_TEMPLATE_HUB/.
PCL Components: 3 web properties, 62 AI apps, 5 spokes.
Figma Kits: 30+ kits mapped to component needs.
PRDs: 8 main PRDs, plus 18 for PCL.
Commit: 9d534ab.

15_glossary.title: Glossary
items: PCL: Property Connect London.
PRD: Product Requirement Document.
Build Factory: Directory (`07_BUILD_FACTORY/`) containing project builds.
Navigation Centre: Directory (`01_NAVIGATION_CENTRE/`) for system state and goals.
State Snapshot: A file capturing the current state of all projects.
Goal Folder: A directory for tracking progress on a specific goal.
Scaffold: A pre-defined folder structure for a project.
Figma Autolayout: A Figma feature for creating responsive designs.

16_future.title: Future
items: Outline all screens needed per build (Property Platform MVP, client promo site, customer promo site).
Identify boilerplate page layouts as base elements for all main pages.
Map which kit components go on which pages.
Learn Figma autolayout for combining elements from multiple kits.
Stress test the system to ensure it works for any LLM (verify Enterprise OS is LLM-agnostic).

17_pending.title: Pending
items: Visual design work for PCL (identified as the bottleneck).
Building screens and pages for prioritized projects.
Learning and applying Figma autolayout.
LLM-agnostic verification for Enterprise OS.

19_meta.title: Meta-Observations
items: Session followed a clear three-block structure (Cleanup, Lock-in, Build).
Discovery of full project scope (PCL) occurred during the 'build' phase, indicating initial planning was incomplete.
System was declared 'clean' at the end, suggesting a successful reset/org phase.
Work produced a significant git commit (51 files, 23,734 lines) indicating substantial file creation and reorganization.

20_assets.title: Reusable Assets
items: Project scaffold template (9-folder structure).
PRD_Enterprise_OS_V7_MASTER.md template/structure.
State snapshot template (`01_NAVIGATION_CENTRE/STATE_SNAPSHOTS/YYYY-MM-DD.md`).
Goal folder structure with progress tracking.
Brand identity brief template.
Priority stack framework for project management.

summary: This session successfully cleaned up the system, organized all projects and PRDs, and began substantive work on the Property Connect London project, discovering its full scale. Key decisions were made on file routing and project priorities, resulting in a organized, ready-to-build state committed to version control.
